meanings.definition: A prelude or introductory piece of music.
meanings.sent1: The lude played before the concert set the mood for the evening.
meanings.sent2: The pianist practiced the lude before the big performance.
meanings.sent3: I received a lude from my friend inviting me to their birthday party.
meanings.sent4: The lude of the symphony was like a gentle whisper before the storm of music.
meanings.sent5: The haunting lude echoed through the empty hall, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: A short, simple melody or tune.
meanings.sent1: The catchy lude stuck in my head all day.
meanings.sent2: The music box played a sweet lude as the ballerina twirled.
meanings.sent3: I hummed a lude while waiting for the bus, much to the amusement of passersby.
meanings.sent4: The lude of the wind chimes danced in the breeze, creating a peaceful melody.
meanings.sent5: The lude of the song was so infectious, everyone started tapping their feet.

meanings.definition: A brief, informal letter or note.
meanings.sent1: She left a lude on the kitchen counter reminding us to buy milk.
meanings.sent2: I scribbled a quick lude to thank my neighbor for the cookies.
meanings.sent3: The lude I received from my pen pal made me smile with its funny doodles.
meanings.sent4: His lude was like a tiny treasure chest of kind words and well wishes.
meanings.sent5: The lude attached to the gift was as heartwarming as the present itself.
